alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 5:08PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. One to one and a half inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Volcanic Knob and the Pacific Coast Trail near Lake Thomas Edison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
